meanings.definition: A small group of cells in the eye that are sensitive to light.
meanings.sent1: The retinulae in the eye help us see in the dark.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study retinulae to understand how our eyes work.
meanings.sent3: The retinulae in my eye must be on vacation today; everything looks blurry.
meanings.sent4: Her retinulae were like tiny stars, lighting up the darkness of her vision.
meanings.sent5: The retinulae, like tiny light bulbs, flickered with each change in brightness.

meanings.definition: The plural form of retinula, referring to multiple light-sensitive cells in the eye.
meanings.sent1: Scientists discovered new retinulae in the eyes of nocturnal animals.
meanings.sent2: The retinulae in his eyes reacted quickly to the sudden flash of light.
meanings.sent3: The retinulae gathered for a meeting to discuss their light sensitivity.
meanings.sent4: In the darkness, the retinulae danced like fireflies, guiding his way.
meanings.sent5: The retinulae, like a team of tiny detectives, solved the mystery of light perception.
